data.title: wendycatpratt
data.meta_description: Read all of the posts by wendycatpratt on Wendy Pratt
data.text:
Little SongFirst year: words left, like Gods returning to the underworld.In the second, I lived as if I we both were dead.The words returned around year three, but hurtto speak, so in the fourth I petrified myself instead:rolled boulder, dumb and heavy-still, until the sixth yearbroke the spell. And in year seventhings began to clear.Though…

The Dawn Chorus zoom writing group returns tomorrow morning, this time with a new offering – the Dusk Chorus for those who are not early birds. Come and join me for an hour of writing in this friendly, no pressure zoom room. In each session we’ll look at a poem or creative non fiction extract,…

And take part in my online course What to Look for in Spring To find out more, follow this link: https://wendypratt.substack.com/p/notes-from-the-war-between-jackdaws

This week, over on Substack, we are looking at the sensation of taste. Come and join us – Late Summer: A Sensory Experience

“I see all the things we write and publish as markers in time.” Follow this link to my Substack page to find out what’s happening: Substack

For the book club in April I had the opportunity to speak to Liz Berry about her brilliant new novel in verse The Home Child. You can read some written answers Liz gave by following this link to my substack newsletter/blog: Liz Berry questions and answers. And in case you missed the love author event,…

Read the blog by following this link: Substack Thirteen This year you come to me in the rain, your name a sudden shock on the lips of a passing woman to her daughter, out walking in the lane. The two recede. Her daughter’s back Is sullen under black layers. The passing cloud of your impermanence…

I’ve now merged my blog and my newsletter and am over on substack. This week I got to announce some amazing news!Click on this link to read my substack newsletter/blog – Notes from the Margin: The Ghost Lake

This week I made the move to combine my blog and my newsletter and to move this over to substack. Substack has more options for reader engagement is a bit of a hub for writers and artists, it already feels like a place where I can spread my wings a little and create some events…

This time of year always makes me itchy to move forward. Is it the snowdrops, and the green shoots of daffodils bravely spearing through the frost? perhaps. Perhaps it’s the subliminal effect of blackbirds beginning to sing in the morning, the way I now sit at my desk in the early morning writing hour and…
